section1.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
section1.body: Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit a website. They help our site work correctly, more securely, provide a better user experience, and allow us to understand how the site works and analyze what can be improved.

section2.title: 2. How We Use Cookies
section2.body: PoolZapp uses cookies for various purposes described below. Unfortunately, in most cases there are no industry-standard options to disable cookies without completely disabling the functionality and features they add to this site.

essential.name: Essential Cookies
essential.purpose: Required for the basic operation of the website, including authentication and security

performance.name: Performance Cookies
performance.purpose: Collect information about how visitors use the site to improve performance

functional.name: Functional Cookies
functional.purpose: Allow the site to remember choices you make to provide enhanced functionality

marketing.name: Marketing Cookies
marketing.purpose: Used to track visitors across websites to display relevant and engaging ads

section5.title: 5. Third-Party Cookies
section5.body: In some special cases, we also use cookies provided by trusted third parties. The following third-party services may set cookies through our site:

section6_1.title: 6.1 Browser Settings
section6_1.body: You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. However, if you do this, you may have to manually adjust some preferences each time you visit a site.

section6_2.title: 6.2 Cookie Preferences Center
section6_2.body: We provide a cookie preferences center where you can manage your cookie settings at any time. You can access it via the cookie banner or in your account settings.
